heading: amazon steps into digital music
subheading: amazon begins offering free music in formats such as liquid audio and mp3. never mind that it's just a marketing move. it will get consumers even more comfortable with the concept of downloadable music. by lindsey arent.
author: lindsey arent
text: amazon.com's latest offer of free digital downloads off its site will likely be a boon for the online music business, industry executives said. "anything that exposes average consumers to digital music is a good thing," said bob davidorf, chief financial officer of audio explosion. "the average joe on the street doesn't know that much about downloadable music. it works to broaden the market."the launch could prove to be digital music's defining moment. now that the wal-mart of the net has officially embraced the downloadable format, the concept of buying music files off the web isn't going to seem strange for very long.read wired news' ongoing digital music coverage
